cause.description:
Only found in the tiny 2.5-square-kilometer Dlinza forest , near the town of Eshowe, in South Africa. The Pinwheel snail is at risk from pollution, climate changes, and changing weather patterns. The Pinwheel snail is currently Critically endangered, and decreasing in population.
1. To expand awareness, knowledge, and protection of the Dlinza Forest Pinwheel Snail.
cause.mission: protect and increase awareness of this rare snail!
cause.name: Protect the Dlinza Forest Pinwheel Snail Mission
